title: Classic Perfumes & Colognes
description: How well do you remember the iconic fragrances that filled the air from the 1940s through the 1980s?

questions.question: Which iconic French perfume, known by its number, was famously endorsed by Marilyn Monroe who said she wore it to bed?
questions.explanation: When asked what she wore to bed, Marilyn Monroe famously replied 'Chanel No. 5.' The fragrance, created in 1921, remained one of the best-selling perfumes for decades.

questions.question: Which men's cologne, introduced in 1957, featured a distinctive ship's wheel on the bottle and a seafaring theme?
questions.explanation: Old Spice, with its iconic nautical-themed bottle and ship on the packaging, became one of America's most popular men's fragrances after its launch in 1937 for women and 1938 for men.

questions.question: Which women's perfume, created in 1948, featured a bottle topped with two intertwined doves?
options: L'Air du Temps by Nina Ricci
questions.explanation: L'Air du Temps by Nina Ricci, launched in 1948, is famous for its beautiful Lalique crystal bottle topped with two intertwined doves, symbolizing peace.

questions.question: Which men's cologne, launched in 1964, came in a green bottle and had the tagline 'All my men wear English Leather, or they wear nothing at all'?
questions.explanation: English Leather cologne, introduced in 1949 but popularized with its famous ad campaign in the 1960s, became a staple men's fragrance for decades.

questions.question: Which budget men's cologne became famous for its humorous 1960s ads warning that women would become uncontrollably attracted to the wearer?
questions.explanation: Hai Karate cologne ran memorable TV ads in the late 1960s showing men having to fend off overly attracted women, complete with self-defense instruction booklet in every box.

questions.question: Which women's perfume by Estee Lauder, introduced in 1953, was known for being left as samples on restaurant plates to get noticed?
questions.explanation: Estee Lauder's Youth Dew, launched in 1953 as a bath oil that doubled as perfume, revolutionized the fragrance industry and was aggressively sampled in creative ways.

questions.question: Which men's aftershave and cologne, introduced in 1964, came in a distinctive green glass bottle and was endorsed by Joe Namath?
questions.explanation: Brut by Faberge, launched in 1964 in its iconic green bottle, became hugely popular with endorsements from athletes like Joe Namath and Henry Cooper.

questions.question: Which classic women's perfume, first sold in 1932, had a 'forbidden' theme and was marketed as daring and provocative?
questions.explanation: Tabu by Dana, created in 1932, was marketed with a provocative image and the idea that it was 'the forbidden fragrance,' making it popular for decades.

questions.question: Which men's cologne, named after an exotic location, came in a distinctive jade-green and gold bottle in the 1960s?
questions.explanation: Jade East cologne, introduced in 1963, featured an Asian-inspired jade-green bottle and became one of the most popular men's fragrances of the 1960s.

questions.question: Which women's fragrance by Revlon, introduced in 1973, had the famous tagline 'The gorgeous, sexy-young fragrance'?
questions.explanation: Charlie by Revlon, launched in 1973, became the world's best-selling fragrance. Its ads featured Shelley Hack as a modern, independent woman.

questions.question: What ice-blue aftershave lotion was famous for its 'There's something about an Aqua Velva man' slogan?
questions.explanation: Aqua Velva, with its distinctive ice-blue color, was one of the most popular aftershave lotions from the 1940s through the 1980s.

questions.question: Which women's perfume had the tagline 'Promise her anything, but give her...' in its famous ad campaign?
questions.explanation: Arpege by Lanvin used the famous tagline 'Promise her anything, but give her Arpege' in advertisements that ran for decades starting in the 1960s.

questions.question: Which 1978 women's fragrance had a commercial jingle that went 'I can bring home the bacon, fry it up in a pan'?
questions.explanation: Enjoli's famous 1978 commercial featured the catchy jingle about a woman who could do it all, perfectly capturing the era's working woman ideal.

questions.question: Which men's cologne brand, launched in 1966, became famous with the slogan 'A man wants to smell like a man'?
questions.explanation: Aramis, launched by Estee Lauder in 1966, was one of the first prestige men's fragrances sold in department stores and helped establish the modern men's grooming market.

questions.question: Which classic women's perfume, still popular today, was originally created in 1925 by Guerlain and featured an Art Deco bottle?
questions.explanation: Shalimar by Guerlain, created in 1925, is one of the world's most enduring perfumes, inspired by the Shalimar Gardens and known for its distinctive Art Deco fan-shaped bottle.
